content.webTitle: The week's highlights: from Mar 24 to Mar 30

fields.headline: The week's highlights
fields.bodyText: Northanger Abbey Sunday, 9pm, ITV1 Yes, yes, more Austin, but Andrew Davies' adaptation of one of her lighter novels is the perfect Sunday evening blend of eruditeness and pretty frocks. Get Your Act Together With Harvey Goldsmith Tuesday, 9pm, C4 Has Mr Goldsmith bitten off more Samantha Mumba than he can chew? He was only trying to help. The Apprentice Wednesday, 9pm, BBC1 The finger is primed and ready to take aim at a new batch of entrepreneurial wannabes out to prove they have the chutzpah, if not the grumpiness, to be a Sugar. Wedding Belles Thursday, 10pm, C4 Sex, drugs, rock'n'roll - this is marriage done Irvine Welsh style. There's a characteristic lack of taste as black comedy and Scottish accents are flexed to the max in his vulgarian romp. Storyville: Screamers Thursday, 10.30pm, BBC4 The 1915 massacre of Armenians by Ottoman Turks and a speed metal band make an unlikely pairing, but System Of A Down are on a mission to make the world listen.
